title: Op-Ed: Infrastructure Delivery Begins with Preparation – South Africa Must Invest in the Front End
summary: South Africa’s infrastructure ambitions will falter if project preparation continues to be treated as an afterthought. The National Infrastructure Plan 2050 estimates that the country requires approximately R4.8 trillion in infrastructure investment by 2030 to achieve inclusive growth and competitiveness.
